009package imagingbook.common.morphology;
010
011import ij.process.Blitter;
012import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Implements a binary morphological dilation operation.
018 * See Sec. 7.2.7 of [1] for additional details.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
022 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/09/18
027 */
028public class BinaryOutline implements BinaryMorphologyOperator {
029        
030        private static final byte[][] H4 = { 
031                        { 0, 1, 0 }, 
032                        { 1, 1, 1 }, 
033                        { 0, 1, 0 }};
034        
035        private static final byte[][] H8 = { 
036                        { 1, 1, 1 }, 
037                        { 1, 1, 1 }, 
038                        { 1, 1, 1 }};
039        
040        private final NeighborhoodType2D nh;
041        
042        /**
043         * Constructor, creates a {@link BinaryOutline} operator using
044         * a 4-neighborhood by default ({@link NeighborhoodType2D#N4}).
045         */
046        public BinaryOutline() {
047                this.nh = NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
048        }
049        
050        /**
051         * Constructor, creates a {@link BinaryOutline} operator using
052         * a the specified neighborhood type ({@link NeighborhoodType2D}).
053         * 
054         * @param nh neighborhood type ({@link NeighborhoodType2D})
055         */
056        public BinaryOutline(NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
057                this.nh = nh;
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        public void applyTo(ByteProcessor ip) {
062                ByteProcessor fg = (ByteProcessor) ip.duplicate();
063                byte[][] H = (nh == NeighborhoodType2D.N4) ? H4 : H8;
064                new BinaryErosion(H).applyTo(fg);       //erode(fg, H);
065                ip.copyBits(fg, 0, 0, Blitter.DIFFERENCE);
066        }
067
068}
